headline.main: On Preparing To Wage War With Germs, Guilt Aplenty

lead_paragraph: If it did not drag on for slightly too long, ''Bioterror'' would be a prime example of that all too rare television commodity, the scientifically accurate horror-thriller. Here are graphic depictions of people suffering and dying from ghastly diseases: smallpox, anthrax and Ebola hemorrhagic fever. We see rabbits being fitted into tiny boxes and stuffed headfirst into biological-agent exposure chambers, soon to die grisly deaths, and later to be dissected.
abstract: Ed Regis reviews Bioterror, program in PBS's Nova series based on Germs, book by three New York Times reporters, Judith Miller, Stephen Engelberg and William Broad

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: GERMS: BIOLOGICAL WEAPONS AND AMERICA'S SECRET WAR (BOOK)
